intro: Anodendron howii, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers, which bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Anodendron howii is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests, where it contributes to the unique biodiversity of Hawaii.
